item.title: Trying to "refresh" applet
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

This isn’t a rsps client. I made it myself to connect to the real RuneScape Classic. My question was how I could temporarily get rid of the applet completely so I can “restart” it with the new world id. Oh and one more thing:

the world id is for the url: http://classic" + worldID + ".runescape.com/ where worldID is either world 1, 2, or 3 (even though 1 is for veterans only I still wanted to add it)

Read full topic

Just change the IP within the client. It should work fine when you try to connect.

item.title: Trying to "refresh" applet
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

Hello. I have been working on a RuneScape Classic client for myself so that I can play the original classic straight from my desktop. I have it working but I’d like to add this world select menu to be able to change worlds while the client is runing. I am sure this is working, but when I call the stop(); and destroy(); methods I need a way to make them go away so that the new “refreshed” applet will show. Anyways here is the part of my code I’m working with:

[code] mBar.add(fileMenu);
fileMenu.add(world);
world.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {

              public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                
                worldID = (String)JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null,
                                               "Choose a world to play on:", "World Select - RuneScape Classic",
                                               JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE,
                                               null,
                                               worldList,
                                               worldList[0]
                                            );
                  applet.stop();
                  applet.destroy();
                  System.out.println("Switched World to "+worldID);
                  Applet applet = (Applet) (client);
                  applet.init();
                  applet.start();
                  setTitle("RuneScape Classic World "+worldID);
                }
                
            });[/code]

Yeah, basically if I could get the applet to completely destroy() it could work, (I think). What do I know…

Read full topic
